title: Untitled
text:
Greenland lawmakers have formed a new coalition government just before Vice President J.D. Vance’s visit. The move signals united opposition to President Trump’s push to take control of the island.

Four parties joined forces, holding 23 of 31 seats, excluding only Naleraq. The timing of the deal aims to show defiance toward U.S. efforts seen as disrespectful and aggressive.

Dwayne Ryan Menezes, founder and managing director of the Polar Research & Policy Initiative, said: “The new coalition agreement… will signal to the Vances… the unity forged in defiance.”

images.title: Blake, Wm. The Making of Magna Carta. 1775.
